ultraviolet.2016: I am listening to your interview with @dawn_serra on the #sexgetsrealpodcast and I cannot agree with you more! Everything you say I keep thinking to myself 'OH MY GODDESS, IS SHE READING MY MIND?!' You are an amazing beautiful STRONG (better yet SEXUALLY strong) woman! I am a bisexual woman married, almost 10 years now, to a man who I truly believe is my twin flame. I love this man dearly and can't help to put him on a pedestal and bow down to him, which, trust me when I say he truly does deserves to have the ground he walks on to be kissed! But, like every relationship, there's been some...hearts broken, trust broken and faith in us lost. There's a lot of repair needed to be done to our foundation. I didn't even consider such a thing until I stumbled across an erotic photo of a man choking a woman while giving her a very sexy kiss full of tongue. The picture screams out "you're mine" in such a way that made my stomach do a million flips, and that's how I found out about my "being vulnerable" fetish. So I spilled the beans and told him every fantasy I ever fantasized about but I'm still having a hard time getting him to explore outside of the school girl costume because he has to have other fantasies right? But I can't get him to tell me, I would hope after 13 years together he wouldn't be too shy or embarrassed but that is the vibe I'm getting. In the meantime I am starting to fantasize more and more about sex with women. And my lust for the feeling of a woman's body in my hands keeps getting stronger and stronger. I feel as if I should tell him because we both agreed being %100 honest with each other but I don't know how to A. Tell him & B. Fulfil this STRONG urge. I've subscribed to your emails and I will be following you on Your social media accounts. Hopefully you can give me that "Ah ha!" moment that answers my questions and curiosities. I am so glad I have found you! I can't wait to soak up some of your wisdom!💙💖💜
runaway_daydreamer: Thank you so much for sharing this post today! 💕 I don’t think I’ve ever commented here before but this caption feels so inviting and safe. As a teenager, I grew up in church, l heard all the “shoulds” of how you shouldn’t have sex if you’re not married and shouldn’t flirt with boys too much cuz they can’t control themselves and all that nonsense. Then in college / first half of my 20s, I “went crazy” as they say, but fell into the different kind of “shoulds” - you should have sex with whoever you want, whenever you want, you should be able to have sex with “no strings attached.” Now at 27, I am trying to find the balance between those shoulds. Feeling free to have sex when I truly want it but also free to say no to sex when it’s not what my heart, spirit, soul, and emotions truly desire. I’ve had too much harmful sex in the name of sexual liberation! “If you want it go and get it”... but I want space to explore the gray area, I want to be allowed to sometimes just really not know what I want. 🤷‍♀️
